/*Go back or forward a number of working days.*/ CREATE FUNCTION [Business_DateAdd_scalar](@IN_DATE DATETIME, @NUMBER INT, @TZ_NAME NVARCHAR(50) = NULL) RETURNS DATETIME AS BEGIN IF @IN_DATE IS NULL RETURN NULL
SET @IN_DATE = (SELECT VALUE FROM [innovator].[Roundtomidnight](@IN_DATE, @TZ_NAME))
IF @NUMBER IS NULL RETURN NULL
DECLARE @RET_DATE DATETIME DECLARE @DAY_NUMBER INT
SET @DAY_NUMBER = (SELECT VALUE FROM [innovator].[Business_day_number](@IN_DATE, @TZ_NAME))
IF NOT @DAY_NUMBER IS NULL BEGIN SET @DAY_NUMBER = Abs(@DAY_NUMBER) + @NUMBER SET @RET_DATE = (SELECT VALUE FROM [innovator].[Business_day_date](@DAY_NUMBER, @TZ_NAME))
IF NOT @RET_DATE IS NULL BEGIN RETURN @RET_DATE END END
-- Otherwise will fall into this slow Peano addition. DECLARE @RET_DAYS INT DECLARE @INC_DAYS INT DECLARE @WORKDAY INT
IF @NUMBER < 0 BEGIN SET @RET_DAYS = -@NUMBER SET @INC_DAYS = -1 END ELSE BEGIN SET @RET_DAYS = @NUMBER SET @INC_DAYS = 1 END
SET @RET_DATE = (SELECT value FROM [innovator].[ConvertToLocal_Table](@IN_DATE, @TZ_NAME)) SET @WORKDAY = 1
WHILE @WORKDAY = 0 OR @RET_DAYS > 0 BEGIN SET @RET_DATE = Dateadd(DAY, @INC_DAYS, @RET_DATE) SET @WORKDAY = [innovator].[Business_workday](@RET_DATE, @TZ_NAME)
IF @WORKDAY = 1 SET @RET_DAYS = @RET_DAYS - 1 END
SET @RET_DATE = (SELECT value FROM [innovator].[ConvertFromLocal_Table](@RET_DATE, @TZ_NAME))
RETURN @RET_DATE END
